panels.description:
ActiveOpens	Client	Outgoing	Web browser, outgoing API call, DB client
PassiveOpens	Server	Incoming	Web server, DB listener, SSH daemon
panels.title: Using Local Ports

panels.description:
SoftIRQ cpu show cpu bottleneck 
SoftIRQs (software interrupts) in Linux are a mechanism for running high-frequency, time-critical, and deferrable kernel tasks, such as network packet processing (\(NET\_RX\)/\(NET\_TX\)) and block I/O. They act as "bottom halves" to hardware interrupts, allowing quick handling of tasks without blocking CPU interrupts. They are statically defined, can run on multiple CPUs simultaneously, and are monitored via /proc/softirqs
panels.title: SoftIRQ

panels.description: Critical! If > 0, your 'somaxconn' is full or the app is stalling.
panels.title: Listen Overflows (App Accept Queue)

panels.description: Drops due to full SYN queue (tcp_max_syn_backlog).
panels.title: SYN/Listen Drops

panels.description: Drops because the application is not reading from the socket buffer fast enough.
panels.title: Receive Queue / Backlog Drops

panels.description: Packet reordering events. High values imply network path issues or bad load balancing.
panels.title: TCP Packet Reordering

panels.description: Packets dropped by the Network Interface Card (NIC) before reaching TCP stack.
panels.title: Network Interface (NIC) Drops

panels.description: Pruning: Kernel discarding data from receive buffers due to memory pressure. Indicates 'tcp_rmem' or 'rmem_max' issues.
panels.title: Kernel Buffer Pruning
